step.cmd: Teacher: creates an assignment (see ), fills in metadata and instruction for students and (optionally) attaches files for the students to work upon.

Teacher: publishes the assignment (see ). Publishing an assignments involves specifing students to whom the assignment is handed out, deadline, and (optionally) additional instructions. Once the assignment is published it becomes active.
Students: recieve an active assignment (see ) and start working on it. Once an assignment is published, it will appear in the list of active assignments in student module(s) upon their startup.
Teacher: monitors students' progress (see ); reviews their work; performs intremediate grading (if necessary); sends the answers back for revision (if necessary); comments on work in progress.
Teacher: finishes grading and issues final grades for the assignment (see ); (optionally) files completed assignment to the archive (see ), and export an assignment report (see )
Students: receive final grade for the assignment and review teacher comments (see )
Teacher: finalizes the assignment (see ) at which point it is considered closed and further modifications become impossible.
